Polairud Polda Kaltim Tangkap Penyelundup 6 Kg Sabu di Samarinda
05 Nov 2019, 23:03 by Mei Amelia R
Jakarta - Polda Kalimantan Timur menangkap seorang penyelundup narkoba di wilayah Samarinda. Dari tersangka bernama Ilham (37), polisi menyita barang bukti 6 kilogram (kg) sabu.
Penangkapan berawal dari adanya informasi yang masuk ke Direktorat Polairud dan Direktorat Narkoba Polda Kaltim. Informasi menyebutkan akan ada narkotika masuk ke Kalimantan Timur dari Tawau, Malaysia, melalui perairan Tanjung Batu, Kabupaten Derau.
"Kemudian barang tersebut dibawa dengan menggunakan jalur darat menuju Samarinda," kata Kasubdit Gakkum Ditpolairud Polda Kaltim Kompol Teguh Nugroho, dalam keterangannya, Selasa (5/11/2019).
Informasi tersebut kemudian ditindaklanjuti, kemudian tim diturunkan ke lokasi untuk melakukan penyelidikan. Hingga pada Sabtu (2/11) diketahui tersangka mengirimkan barang lewat jalur darat.
"Tepatnya di Jalan Bhayangkara Taman Samarendag, Kecamatan Samarinda, tim melihat sebuah mobil yang melaju dengan kecepatan tinggi, sehingga menimbulkan kecurigaan," tuturnya.
Polisi kemudian mengejar mobil tersebut dan menyergapnya. Di mobil tersebut didapati tersangka Ilham yang mengemudikan mobil tersebut.
"Kemudian dilakukan penggeledahan oleh tim dan ditemukan 6 paket besar narkotika jenis sabu seberat 6 kg," tuturnya.
Tersangka kemudian diamankan dan diinterogasi. Hasil pendalaman menunjukkan tersangka mengaku mendapatkan barang tersebut dari seseorang berinisial OPA.
"OPA ini masih DPO, dia berkomunikasi dengan tersangka melalui sambungan telepon. Saat ini masih kami kembangkan," tandasnya.

(mei/jbr)

East Kalimantan Regional Police Headquarters Arrests Smugglers of 6 Kg Sabu in Samarinda
05 Nov 2019, 23:03 by Mei Amelia R
Jakarta - The East Kalimantan Regional Police arrested a drug smuggler in Samarinda area. From the suspect named Ilham (37), the police confiscated 6 kilograms (meth) of methamphetamine evidence.
The arrest began with information entering the Directorate of Polairud and the East Kalimantan Regional Police Narcotics Directorate. Information says there will be narcotics entering East Kalimantan from Tawau, Malaysia, through the waters of Tanjung Batu, Derau Regency.
"Then the goods are taken by road to Samarinda," said East Kalimantan Regional Police Head of East Kalimantan Regional Police Kompol Teguh Nugroho, in his statement on Tuesday (5/11/2019).
The information is then followed up, then the team is sent to the location to conduct an investigation. Until Saturday (11/2) it was found that the suspect sent goods by land.
"Precisely on Jalan Bhayangkara Taman Samarendag, Samarinda District, the team saw a car traveling at high speed, causing suspicion," he said.
The police then chased the car and ambushed him. In the car found the suspect Ilham who drove the car.
"Then a search was carried out by the team and found 6 large packages of narcotic type of methamphetamine weighing 6 kg," he said.
The suspect is then secured and interrogated. The results of the investigation showed that the suspect claimed to get the item from someone with the initials OPA.
"This OPA is still a DPO, he communicates with the suspect through telephone connections. At present we are still developing it," he said.

(may / hr)
